title: Chelsea v Manchester United betting odds: Blues look strong
text:
Premier League heavyweights Chelsea and Manchester United will fight it out at Stamford Bridge for a place in the Carabao Cup quarter-final

Chelsea look unstoppable

Chelsea continued their impressive form by stretching their winning streak to seven in all competitions at Turf Moor on Saturday.

The Blues won 4-2 away to Burnley but were 4-0 up within an hour as they knocked the ball around with confidence and purpose.

Back at Stamford Bridge and will fancy their chances to make it eight wins in a row, with William Hill offering a home win at 17/20.

Chelsea started their run with a 7-1 drubbing of Grimsby Town and there ought to be goals again tonight. Over 2.5 Goals is priced at 4/5.

Rashford’s half-century boost

Marcus Rashford has not been at his consistent best this season but had a reason to celebrate on Sunday.

His goal in the 3-1 win away to Norwich City was his 50th in a Manchester United shirt.

Rashford reached the mark in fewer games (183) than it took Cristiano Ronaldo (188) and it could be a confidence boost for the striker, who is 2/1 to score at any time.

Batshuayi to make his mark

This Carabao Cup tie presents the perfect opportunity for Michy Batshuayi to stake his claim for a regular first-team place.

The Belgian has made just seven appearances so far but scored four times, including two against Grimsby, and is 23/20 to score at any time against United.

His most recent goal for Chelsea sealed a 1-0 Champions League win away to Ajax and the same result with Batshuayi to score is 22/1.

United’s chance of silverware

Manchester United are realistically out of the title race so the cup competitions give Ole Gunnar Solskjaer his best chance of a trophy in his first full season as manager.

The Red Devils will be up for this one and William Hill have them at 16/5 to come out victorious in 90 minutes and 13/10 to qualify.

Solskjaer’s side are also unbeaten in their last four against Chelsea, including an impressive 4-0 win on the opening day.

United are 7/2 to keep their second clean sheet of the season against Chelsea.

Another hat-trick for Pulisic?

It would have been impossible not to talk about Christian Pulisic’s hat-trick against Burnley.

The American scored with his right foot, left foot and head in his best performance yet in a Chelsea shirt.

United will pose a different test for Chelsea, but if you fancy Pulisic to score another hat-trick, he is 250/1 with William Hill.

For those not as confident in Pulisic’s consistency in front of goal, you can get him at 27/10 to score at any time.

The Martial effect

Anthony Martial is back from injury and reminding United fans what they were missing in his absence.

The Frenchman has scored against FK Partizan and Norwich since returning and has helped United win 77% of the games in which he has started in the Premier League.

United fans will be hoping he can transfer that talismanic touch to the Carabao Cup and William Hill have Martial at 11/2 to score at any time and United to win.
description: Betting preview as Premier League heavyweights Chelsea and Manchester United will fight it out for a place in the Carabao Cup quarter-final at Stamford Bridge
